class.name: ReSharperDuplicates
class.description: A [Duplicates finder (ReSharper) build step](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/?duplicates-finder-resharper) to find C# and VB duplicate code.

function.name: reSharperDuplicates

param.name: dotnet-tools-dupfinder.include_files
param.description: Use newline-delimited Ant-like wildcards relative to the checkout root to specify the files to be included into the duplicates search. Visual Studio solution files are parsed and replaced by all source files from all projects within a solution. Example: src\MySolution.sln

param.name: dotnet-tools-dupfinder.exclude_files
param.description: Enter newline-delimited Ant-like wildcards to exclude files from the duplicates search (for example, generated{*}{}.cs). The entries should be relative to the checkout root.

param.name: jetbrains.resharper-clt.clt-path
param.description: A custom path to R# CLT Home Directory. Paths relative to the checkout directory are supported. The value can reference to JetBrains ReSharper Command Line Tool specified via Administration | Tools.

param.name: jetbrains.resharper-clt.platform
param.description: The platform bitness of the dupFinder tool. By default, x64. The cross-platform duplicates finder is also supported in ReSharper 2020.2.1 or later.

param.name: dotnet-tools-dupfinder.hashing.normalize_types
param.description: If this option is checked, similar contents with different namespace specifications will be recognized as duplicates.

param.name: dotnet-tools-dupfinder.hashing.discard_types
param.description: If this option is checked, similar content with different type names will be recognized as duplicates. These include all possible type references.

param.name: dotnet-tools-dupfinder.hashing.discard_fields_name
param.description: If this option is checked, the similar code fragments with different field names will be recognized as duplicates.

param.name: dotnet-tools-dupfinder.hashing.discard_local_variables_name
param.description: If this option is checked, similar code fragments with different local variable names will be recognized as duplicates.

param.name: dotnet-tools-dupfinder.hashing.discard_literals
param.description: If this option is checked, similar lines of code with different literals will be recognized as duplicates.

param.name: dotnet-tools-dupfinder.discard_cost
param.description: Ignore duplicates with complexity lower than given value. Use this field to specify the lowest level of complexity of code blocks to be taken into consideration when detecting duplicates. Positive numbers and parameter references are supported.

param.name: dotnet-tools-dupfinder.exclude_by_opening_comment
param.description: Skip files by opening comment. Enter newline-delimited keywords to exclude files that contain the keyword in the file's opening comments from the duplicates search.

param.name: dotnet-tools-dupfinder.exclude_region_message_substring
param.description: Skip regions by message substring. Enter newline-delimited keywords that exclude regions that contain the keyword in the message substring from the duplicates search. Entering "generated code", for example, will skip regions containing "Windows Form Designer generated code".

param.name: dotnet-tools-dupfinder.debug
param.description: Set true to include debug messages in the build log and publish the file with additional logs (dotnet-tools-dupfinder.log) as an artifact

param.name: dotnet-tools-dupfinder.customCmdArgs
param.description: Specify newline-separated command line parameters to add to calling dupFinder.exe.
